column4: An unknown program suddenly and quite quickly has filled my hard drive. "100% used" - what can I do to find out, what happened?
baobab can tell you whats using a lot of disk space
pretty sure nautilus uses key bindings and these arent hard coded in the source

I didn't see it in the preferences of Nautilus. The terminal at least lets me view the settings. Should I be expecting  to find some tool in the Administration menu of the top panel, for changing these? Timo_: Try CTRL+PageUp/PageDown
you have to tinker with the bootscritps a bit to change the text and colors these output
manipulating init-functions sounds like a decent place to do it
i want to have the "if log_use_fancy_output; then" to trigger... i cant find that function
im sure its possible, but cant be specific on where you should look
well does the boot sequence echo ok to begin with?
the init scripts return 0 on success. if they return anything else, it ends up in [fail] or something. i don't know, where the calling script is.
sender: one cannot unmount /home, if they sudoed themselves to root. Therefore my root account has a password.
heh yeah that poses a problem
really? thought that appliead to GPUs only
let me rephase, No recent cpu will reach 130
130W power dissipation you mean? if you read out the sensors it will probably say tjunction max is 110 or 100?
that may actually not work very well because those are started with the same privs as the user that is loging in
